fxInfo_clarification: This index follows the same logic as Political Constraints Index III (h_polcon3) but also includes two additional veto points: the judiciary and sub-federal entities.
fxInfo_notes: The coding reflects information as of January 1 in any given year. Henisz (2000) uses this index to measure the impact on cross-national growth rates of a governmentâ€™s ability to provide credible commitment.
fxInfo_scale: The index scores are derived from a simple spatial model and theoretically ranges from 0 to 1, with higher scores indicating more political constraint and thus less feasibility of policy change
fxInfo_sources: The Political Constraint Index POLCON Dataset (2017).
name: e_h_polcon5
